channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Rivian Reveals New AI Assistant, Lidar, and Autonomous Driving Coming in 2026
item.description: This EV company is trying to become more affordable and wants to cut Nvidia out of the process.

item.title: OpenAI admits new models likely to pose 'high' cybersecurity risk
item.description: Better models also mean higher risk, but there are mitigations.

item.title: The market has ‘switched’ and founders have the power now, VCs say
item.description: Graham & Walker’s Leslie Feinzaig and XYZ Venture’s Ross Fubini share the secrets for founders — and VCs — to make the most of the current fast pace of dealmaking.

item.title: Everything We Saw in the First Trailer for ‘Supergirl’
item.description: The first trailer for the next DC Studios movie is filled with nods to the comic book story that inspired it.

item.title: Fortnite is back in Google’s Android app store
item.description: Fortnite players on Android devices in the US can once again download the game directly from the Google Play Store, not long after it returned to Apple's App Store in May. Its return comes five years after it was removed from Google's app store as Epic Games pushed back against Apple and Google's app store […]

item.title: The 45 Best Movies on Hulu, WIRED's Picks (December 2025)
item.description: Gremlins, Home Alone, and Sovereign are just a few of the movies you need to watch on Hulu right now.

item.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
item.description: If you know where to look, you can often score discounts on Apple’s ever-expanding AirPods lineup. Both the AirPods Max and AirPods 4 (with and without ANC) now consistently receive sizable discounts, as do the newer AirPods Pro 3. Recent shopping events like Black Friday and Cyber Monday brought some of the steepest price cuts […]

item.title: Want a digital license plate? The Sony Afeela 1 will be the first car to offer one –and you'll be able to add your Instagram handle
item.description: The Sony Honda Afeela 1 will be the first car to offer a digital license plate –here's how it works.

item.title: Intelligence artificielle | OpenAI lance un nouveau modèle
item.description: OpenAI a lancé jeudi son nouveau modèle d’intelligence artificielle (IA), GPT-5.2, dans une tentative de réaffirmer sa suprématie quelques jours après le déclenchement d’une « alerte rouge » en interne face à la concurrence grandissante du Gemini de Google et d’autres modèles.

item.title: Fortnite is back on the Google Play Store
item.description: Epic Games has spent a lot of time in court over the past several years, but it seems the company's litigious era may be winding down. The company announced today that its game Fortnite is back on the Google Play mobile store in the US. Fortnite's return to Android devices means Epic's popular hit is now available on just about every gaming platform following five years of arguing antitrust lawsuits. Epic took both Google and Apple to court over their policies for mobile payment systems back in 2020. The gaming company has been successful on the whole in its challenges, most recently reaching ...

item.title: How to try GPT-5.2, the new ChatGPT model series from OpenAI
item.description: GPT-5.2 should be available for some on its release date, Dec. 11, 2025. The newest ChatGPT model from OpenAI will be available to paid users first.

item.title: OpenAI Drops GPT-5.2 Amid Its ‘Code Red’ Freak Out
item.description: Surely this is the update that turns everything around.

item.title: Epic Games’s Fortnite is back in US Google Play Store, as court partially reverses restrictions it won on iOS
item.description: The game is back on the Google Play Store, but another court decision is rolling back some of the developer-friendly changes on iOS.

item.title: BTC price: Why is Bitcoin, XRP, and other crypto down on Fed rate cut when the stock market is up?
item.description: Much of the cryptocurrency market is down today despite the Federal Reserve’s highly anticipated interest rate cut. What gives? As we enter the 2025 home stretch, Bitcoin is once again down, and dipped below $90,000 on Thursday, following the Federal Reserve’s highly anticipated interest rate cut by 25 basis points on December 10.

item.title: Your Next Flight Might Be Directed From Space
item.description: The Iris system uses satellites for communication between pilots and air traffic controllers.

item.title: Remember Google Stadia? Steam finally made its gamepad worth rescuing
item.description: December 31st, 2025 is the deadline to save the Google Stadia controller. That's less than three weeks from today - but there's never been a better time. Last month, I discovered the controller is finally a first-class citizen in Steam and SteamOS. The Stadia controller was originally designed to connect to your Wi-Fi network and […]

item.title: Elon Musk Abandoned the Name ‘Twitter,’ This Startup Wants to Claim it
item.description: Operation Bluebird is taking flight.

item.title: OpenAI launches GPT-5.2, claiming it hallucinates less and responds better to mental illness
item.description: OpenAI announced that it's launching GPT-5.2, the newest model in its GPT‑5 series, with the rollout starting Dec. 11.

item.title: Google releases emergency fix for yet another zero-day
item.description: Details are being withheld until the patch is deployed.

item.title: ‘Architects of AI’ named Time’s 2025 Person of the Year
item.description: The magazine was deliberate in selecting people rather than the technology itself. The “Architects of AI” were named Time’s person of the year Thursday, with the magazine citing 2025 as when the potential of artificial intelligence “roared into view” with no turning back.

item.title: Best Holiday Coffee Subscription Deals (2025): Atlas, Trade
item.description: Coffee subscriptions offer their steepest discounts in December—including on WIRED’s two favorite coffee subscriptions.

item.title: Amazon’s Official ‘Fallout’ Season 1 Recap Is AI Garbage Filled With Mistakes
item.description: Prime Video's latest needle-poke into generative AI's bubble comes on the heels of its anime dubbing debacle.

item.title: The best Xbox controller to buy right now
item.description: We live in a golden age of controllers. The gamepads on the market now are of higher quality, more versatile, and more customizable than anything from even one console generation ago. If you play games on an Xbox Series X or Series S (or a Windows PC), you have the unenviable task of choosing between […]

item.title: Trump’s $100,000 fee on H-1B visas is backfiring—and shutting out foreign workers
item.description: The decades-old program may need to be reformed, but experts say the exorbitant new fee won’t deter companies from abusing it. This fall, President Trump took aim at the H-1B visa, in a move that has been telegraphed for years amid criticism that the program diverts jobs away from American workers. In September, Trump announced that new applications for the work visa would now be subject to a $100,000 fee—a bold attempt to curtail excessive use of the H-1B program. ...

item.title: Doxers Posing as Cops Are Tricking Big Tech Firms Into Sharing People’s Private Data
item.description: A spoofed email address and an easily faked document is all it takes for major tech companies to hand over your most personal information.

item.title: Disney hits Google with cease-and-desist claiming ‘massive’ copyright infringement
item.description: Disney is accusing the tech giant of unauthorized distribution of its copyrighted characters without permission via Gemini AI.

item.title: GPT-5.2 est là : la réponse de ChatGPT à Google Gemini 3
item.description: OpenAI a dévoilé GPT-5.2, son nouveau LLM le plus puissant à ce jour. La firme espère rattraper l'avance prise par Google avec Gemini 3 Pro.

item.title: OpenAI releases GPT-5.2 to take on Google and Anthropic
item.description: OpenAI's "code red" response to Google's Gemini 3 Pro has arrived. On the same day the company announced a Sora licensing pact with Disney, it took the wraps off GPT-5.2. OpenAI is touting the new model as its best yet for real-world, professional use. “It’s better at creating spreadsheets, building presentations, writing code, perceiving images, understanding long contexts, using tools, and handling complex, multi-step projects,” said OpenAI.In a series of 10 benchmarks highlighted by OpenAI, GPT-5.2 Thinking, the most advanced version of the model, outperformed its GPT-5.1 counterpart, some...

item.title: Russian airline hack came through third-party tech vendor
item.description: Local journalists are investigating last summer's breach allegedly done by Ukrainian and Belarussian hacktivists.

item.title: I tested a bunch of Switch 2 screen protectors, and these are the best
item.description: A glass screen protector is one of a few essential accessories that every Switch 2 owner should buy, along with a select few others. In fact, it should be a priority to stick one onto the console’s screen as soon as possible to avoid accidental scratches. To test the candidates below, I installed and removed […]

item.title: Lawsuit accuses ChatGPT of reinforcing delusions that led to a woman's death
item.description: OpenAI has been hit with a wrongful death lawsuit after a man killed his mother and took his own life back in August, according to a report by The Verge. The suit names CEO Sam Altman and accuses ChatGPT of putting a "target" on the back of victim Suzanne Adams, an 83-year-old woman who was killed in her home. The victim's estate claims the killer, 56-year-old Stein-Erik Soelberg, engaged in delusion-soaked conversations with ChatGPT in which the bot "validated and magnified" certain "paranoid beliefs." The suit goes on to suggest that the chatbot "eagerly accepted" delusional thoughts leading...

item.title: China Launches 34,175-Mile AI Network That Acts Like One Massive Supercomputer
item.description: If the system holds out long-term, it could significantly boost AI development in China.
